Science tells

and the climate is changing
faster than ever before.

Researchers and scientists are focused
on identifying solutions
to help communities at risk.

But one of their biggest roadblocks
is getting access to climate data.

Too much important data
like weather forecasts, climate projections,

and satellite images is stored
in large files, which most people

can't access without the help of expensive
and powerful computers.

But Amazon is working on a solution
to this data and computing problem.

The Amazon Sustainability Data Initiative,
known as ASDI, is a program

that collaborates with scientific
organizations around the world,
like NASA, to identify important data
and then host the data on the AWS cloud.

To make it available
for anyone to access at no charge.

and government leaders

make notable progress
on climate solutions.
